result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Beach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas J. Beach is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas J. Beach was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO PIERCE COUNTY CASE 14CF91

NOTICE OF HEARING RE: RESTITUTION RETURNED   -   ATTEMPTED TO CALL 2 DIFFERENT NUMBERS, NEITHER OF WHICH WORKED
Restitution hearing at 04-27-2015 02:30 pm.
from Liesl Nelson requesting a restitution hearing

3:03 Defendant Nicholas J. Beach in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF70 heard at this time. Froelich: 14CF70 dismiss Ct#1, guilty to Ct#2. 2 years probation: restitution TBD.  14CF91: guilty charge contained in amended information. 2 years probation. Nelson and Def agree. Froelich files amended information. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 14CF70 and guilty to charge contained in the amended information; Nelson stipulates to a factual basis for conviction.  Def pleas guilty to amended charge in 14CF91; Nelson stipulates to factual basis for conviction.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#2 in 14CF70 and charge contained in the amended information in 14CF91. Dismisses Ct#1 in 14CF70. Froelich and Nelson address sentencing. Court: S/W 2 years probation on each conviction, concurrent. conditions: restitution TBD in 30 days (14CF70), court costs.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on February 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
